newsitem.title: UK: UK's jobs record at risk if Labour wins - Heseltine.
newsitem.headline: UK's jobs record at risk if Labour wins - Heseltine.

text.p: Deputy Prime Minister Michael Heseltine said on Wednesday that jobless data proved that Britain was "booming" and warned that the country's "excellent record would be at risk under a Labour government".

Speaking after figures showing a 68,200 drop in unemployment in February from January, Heseltine said even Britain's worst jobs blackspot regions now had jobless rates comparable with the most prosperous regions of Germany.

"Britain is booming. Britain is doing extraordinarily well. The figures clearly reveal it," Heseltine told a news conference at Conservative headquarters designed to boost the party ahead of a May 1 election.

"Our excellent record would be at risk under a Labour government," he added. "Under Labour Britain simply would not work as effectively as it does today, so don't risk your jobs with a Labour government."
The news conference began with a series of messages flashed on a screen detailing monthly falls in the jobless total since last August, a total drop of 378,900.

Heseltine listed 10 reasons why he believed that Labour would end the record of shrinking dole queues, including its intention to bring in a national minimum wage, to join the European Union social chapter, and to increase trade union powers.
"The choice for Britain is...between a party tbat understands how to get unemployment down and one that does not," Heseltine said.
